pois.name: Ferry Building

scripts.friendly: Welcome to the Ferry Building! This landmark opened in 1898 and was once the second busiest transit terminal in the world. Today it houses a famous marketplace with local food and shops. The clock tower is one of the city's most recognizable symbols.

facts: Clock tower is a city symbol

scripts.friendly: The Transamerica Pyramid was completed in 1972 and was the tallest skyscraper in San Francisco until 2018. Its distinctive shape was designed to allow more sunlight to reach the streets below.
This is the Dragon Gate, the entrance to Chinatown. San Francisco's Chinatown is the oldest in North America. The gate was dedicated in 1970 and features figures from Chinese mythology.

pois.name: Union Square

scripts.friendly: Union Square is the heart of downtown shopping and culture. The Dewey Monument honors Admiral Dewey's victory at Manila Bay. During the Civil War, pro-Union rallies were held here—hence the name.

facts: Named for Civil War Union rallies

scripts.friendly: You're at the Powell Street cable car turnaround. The cable car system started in 1873 and is the last manually operated system of its kind. Watching the turntable spin the cars is a classic San Francisco moment.

SFMOMA holds one of the largest collections of modern and contemporary art in the world. The building was expanded in 2016 with a striking addition by Snøhetta. Even from outside, the architecture is worth a pause.
